type.name: org.gradle.api.initialization.dsl.ScriptHandler
type.description:
A ScriptHandler allows you to manage the compilation and execution of a build script. You can declare the classpath used to compile and execute a build script. This classpath is also used to load the plugins which the build script uses.

You can obtain a ScriptHandler instance using org.gradle.api.Project#getBuildscript() or org.gradle.api.Script#getBuildscript().

To declare the script classpath, you use the org.gradle.api.artifacts.dsl.DependencyHandler provided by #getDependencies() to attach dependencies to the {@value #CLASSPATH_CONFIGURATION} configuration. These dependencies are resolved just prior to script compilation, and assembled into the classpath for the script.

For most external dependencies you will also need to declare one or more repositories where the dependencies can be found, using the org.gradle.api.artifacts.dsl.RepositoryHandler provided by #getRepositories().

method.name: dependencies
method.description:
Configures the dependencies for the script. Executes the given closure against the DependencyHandler for this handler. The DependencyHandler is passed to the closure as the closure's delegate.
param:configureClosure the closure to use to configure the dependencies.

method.name: getClassLoader
method.description:
Returns the ClassLoader which contains the classpath for this script.

returns:The ClassLoader. Never returns null.

method.name: getConfigurations
method.description:
Returns the configurations of this handler. This usually contains a single configuration, called {@value #CLASSPATH_CONFIGURATION}.

returns:The configuration of this handler.

method.name: getDependencies
method.description:
Returns the dependencies of the script. The returned dependency handler instance can be used for adding new dependencies. For accessing already declared dependencies, the configurations can be used.

returns:the dependency handler. Never returns null. @see #getConfigurations()

method.name: getRepositories
method.description:
Returns a handler to create repositories which are used for retrieving dependencies for the script classpath.

returns:the repository handler. Never returns null.

method.name: getSourceFile
method.description:
Returns the file containing the source for the script, if any.

returns:The source file. Returns null if the script source is not a file.

method.name: getSourceURI
method.description:
Returns the URI for the script source, if any.

returns:The source URI. Returns null if the script source has no URI.

method.name: repositories
method.description:
Configures the repositories for the script dependencies. Executes the given closure against the RepositoryHandler for this handler. The RepositoryHandler is passed to the closure as the closure's delegate.
param:configureClosure the closure to use to configure the repositories.

property.name: classLoader
property.description:
Returns the ClassLoader which contains the classpath for this script.

returns:The ClassLoader. Never returns null.

property.name: configurations
property.description:
Returns the configurations of this handler. This usually contains a single configuration, called {@value #CLASSPATH_CONFIGURATION}.

returns:The configuration of this handler.

property.name: dependencies
property.description:
Returns the dependencies of the script. The returned dependency handler instance can be used for adding new dependencies. For accessing already declared dependencies, the configurations can be used.

returns:the dependency handler. Never returns null. @see #getConfigurations()

property.name: repositories
property.description:
Returns a handler to create repositories which are used for retrieving dependencies for the script classpath.

returns:the repository handler. Never returns null.

property.name: sourceFile
property.description:
Returns the file containing the source for the script, if any.

returns:The source file. Returns null if the script source is not a file.

property.name: sourceURI
property.description:
Returns the URI for the script source, if any.

returns:The source URI. Returns null if the script source has no URI.
